abstract: Capital IQ has calculated the change in stock prices of a handful of big firms, including the nation’s largest banks, have fared since the collapse of Bear Stearns four years ago.
snippet: Capital IQ has calculated the change in stock prices of a handful of big firms, including the nation’s largest banks, have fared since the collapse of Bear Stearns four years ago.
lead_paragraph: Friday is the four-year anniversary of Bear Stearns‘s fire sale to JPMorgan Chase for $2 a share, one of the signal moments of the financial crisis.

headline.main: How Wall Street Has Fared After Bear’s Fall

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
